details.title: Urban RF multipath mitigation

authors.affiliation: Department of Electrical Engineering, Wright State University, 313 Russ Engineering Center, 3640 Colonel Glenn Highway
authors.name: B.D. Rigling

details.abstract: Sensing in urban environments is of growing interest to the surveillance community, as is observation of targets with micro-Doppler features - elements of the target structure with independent range-Doppler behaviour about some target centroid. Multipath effects unique in character to urban sensing can conceal important features in the range-Doppler response of a target with micro-Doppler behaviour. The range-Doppler smearing because of multipath is analysed, and this analysis serves as the basis for a prominent point multipath mitigation algorithm. The effectiveness of this technique is evaluated with simulated micro-Doppler data with artificial multipath effects.

ieee.title: MCMC particle filter for tracking in a partially known multipath environment
ieee.displayText: B. Sachintha Karunaratne, Mark R. Morelande, Bill Moran, "MCMC particle filter for tracking in a partially known multipath environment", Acoustics Speech and Signal Processing (ICASSP) 2013 IEEE International Conference on, pp. 6332-6336, 2013, ISSN 1520-6149.

ieee.title: Radar surveillance in urban environments
ieee.displayText: Dave Tahmoush, Jerry Silvious, Bob Bender, "Radar surveillance in urban environments", Radar Conference (RADAR) 2012 IEEE, pp. 0220-0225, 2012, ISSN 1097-5659.

ieee.title: Multiple Target Tracking in Urban Environments
ieee.displayText: Meng Zhou, Jun Jason Zhang, Antonia Papandreou-Suppappola, "Multiple Target Tracking in Urban Environments", Signal Processing IEEE Transactions on, vol. 64, pp. 1270-1279, 2016, ISSN 1053-587X.

ieee.title: Multipath exploitationwith adaptivewaveform design for tracking in urban terrain

Morrell, "Multipath exploitationwith adaptivewaveform design for tracking in urban terrain", Acoustics Speech and Signal Processing (ICASSP) 2010 IEEE International Conference on, pp. 3894-3897, 2010, ISSN 1520-6149.

ieee.title: A low-complexity sparsity-based multi-target tracking algorithm for urban environments
ieee.displayText: Phani Chavali, Arye Nehorai, "A low-complexity sparsity-based multi-target tracking algorithm for urban environments", Radar Conference (RADAR) 2011 IEEE, pp. 309-314, 2011, ISSN 1097-5659.

ieee.title: A Kalman-based tracker exploiting spillover of target energy at the detection stage
ieee.displayText: M. Del Coco, D. Orlando, G. Ricci, "A Kalman-based tracker exploiting spillover of target energy at the detection stage", Radar Conference (RADAR) 2012 IEEE, pp. 0618-0622, 2012, ISSN 1097-5659.

ieee.title: RF/Microwave Imaging of Sparse Targets in Urban Areas
ieee.displayText: Gianluca Gennarelli, Ilaria Catapano, Francesco Soldovieri, "RF/Microwave Imaging of Sparse Targets in Urban Areas", Antennas and Wireless Propagation Letters IEEE, vol. 12, pp. 643-646, 2013, ISSN 1536-1225.

ieee.title: Comparative Analysis of Two Approaches for Multipath Ghost Suppression in Radar Imaging
ieee.displayText: G. Gennarelli, G. Vivone, P. Braca, F. Soldovieri, M. G. Amin, "Comparative Analysis of Two Approaches for Multipath Ghost Suppression in Radar Imaging", Geoscience and Remote Sensing Letters IEEE, vol. 13, pp. 1226-1230, 2016, ISSN 1545-598X.

ieee.title: Multipath mitigation for a phase-based infrared ranging system applied to indoor positioning
ieee.displayText: D. Salido-Monzu, E. Martin-Gorostiza, J. L. Lazaro-Galilea, F. Domingo-Perez, Andreas Wieser, "Multipath mitigation for a phase-based infrared ranging system applied to indoor positioning", Indoor Positioning and Indoor Navigation (IPIN) 2013 International Conference on, pp. 1-10, 2013.
